item.title: Caterer that paid up over mice in school kitchen returns to profit
item.description:
ABM, owned by the billionaire Coates family, was also named and shamed for not paying staff the minimum wage

A catering company owned by the billionaire Coates family has reported a return to profit, after it emerged that the company had served food from a mouse-infested kitchen to primary school children and failed to pay staff the minimum wage.

ABM Catering Solutions is owned by the Labour donor Peter Coates and his family, including his daughter Denise, who is known for her record-breaking pay deals for running the familyâ€™s Bet365 gambling empire.

Continue reading...

item.title: Apple is reportedly forging ahead with a rotating, iPad-like tabletop device
